publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-939# Cathy Peattie: Stop Violence Against Women-That the Parliament notes that 8 March 2004 is International Women's Day; further notes that throughout the world women and children continue to suffer from violence and abuse; congratulates Amnesty International who on 5 March 2004 launch their global "Stop Violence Against Women" campaign; notes that in Scotland only a small percentage of domestic abuse incidents result in successful prosecutions, and believes therefore that the Scottish Executive should build on existing partnership work to ensure that the justice system affords protection to victims and acts as a deterrent to perpetrators. Supported by: Mark Ballard*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Scott Barrie*

S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Marlyn Glen*, Sarah Boyack*, Nora Radcliffe*, Susan Deacon*, Eleanor Scott*, Chris Ballance*, Bill Butler*, Margaret Jamieson*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Frances Curran*, Kate Maclean*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Alex Neil*, Bristow Muldoon*, Michael McMahon*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Cathie Craigie*, Maureen Macmillan*, Johann Lamont*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Christine May*, Karen Whitefield*

S2M-939# Cathy Peattie: Stop Violence Against Women-That the Parliament notes that 8 March 2004 is International Women's Day; further notes that throughout the world women and children continue to suffer from violence and abuse; congratulates Amnesty International who on 5 March 2004 launch their global "Stop Violence Against Women" campaign; notes that in Scotland only a small percentage of domestic abuse incidents result in successful prosecutions, and believes therefore that the Scottish Executive should build on existing partnership work to ensure that the justice system affords protection to victims and acts as a deterrent to perpetrators. Supported by: Mark Ballard, Scott Barrie, Marlyn Glen, Sarah Boyack, Nora Radcliffe, Susan Deacon, Eleanor Scott, Chris Ballance, Bill Butler, Margaret Jamieson, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Frances Curran, Kate Maclean, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Alex Neil, Bristow Muldoon, Michael McMahon, Marilyn Livingstone, Cathie Craigie, Maureen Macmillan, Johann Lamont, Nicola Sturgeon, Ms Wendy Alexander, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Christine May, Karen Whitefield, Ms Sandra White*, Christine Grahame*, Robin Harper*, Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Murray Tosh*, Rob Gibson*, Elaine Smith*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Helen Eadie*, Janis Hughes*, Jackie Baillie*, Carolyn Leckie*, Trish Godman*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Dr Jean Turner*, Irene Oldfather*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Mike Watson*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Stewart Stevenson*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Dennis Canavan*, Pauline McNeill*, Shiona Baird*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Jeremy Purvis*
S2M-939# Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 24 February 2004) Richard Baker*
